page.title: 05Coates Church-Holy Trinity
page.content: Coates church was built in 1840 by a firm called Bennett. It took about a year and a half to build,and was dedi- cated on July 28th 1840. The money was from collections and donations. The bell was hung about 1841. There is a font in the church,but the original is in the Rector's garden. The church cost Â£1178 to build. The clock in the tower was given by Cecil Hart of Whittlesey,who used to have a cinema in the town. The stained glass windows,dated 1976,cost about Â£500 or Â£600. The church was painted by Mr.Cook who lives on South Green. The churchyard is quite big. The church has a small choir of about ten children and adults. The choir wear cassocks which are kept in the vestry. When you are in the choir there is a practice every Friday. There is a service every Sunday at ten
